name: places/ChIJVSUwzuL1wokRPbyNHm3PIbc
adrFormatAddress: 2326 1st Ave., New York, NY 10035, USA

originalText.text: The owner tried to find something to fail my inspection so that I would buy something from his shop.  First it was the tires (they are all less than 8 months old), then he peeled my back windshield wiper (also less than 6 months old) and told me that he can order them for me... no thank you!   Now I have a peeling back windshield wiper.   I want to believe that it was not a gender thing, but the other person who left a one star review had a similar experience.   Stay away or film him when he is conducting the review.

originalText.text: The man in charge there tries to look for the most irrelevant things to fail you if you’re a woman. I took my brand new car of the year and he said it needed some fixing. He wanted me to pay upfront. When i asked for a receipt he fussed about it. Like. Who doesn’t give a receipt these days? Then he proceeded to check other stuff than what he “failed” me for. He called someone above him, scanned a random barcode and took a picture of my registration. And spoke in a different language which i didn’t understand. Which is very unprofessional bc it has to do about my car. Honestly, they are very sketchy there. My advice would be, go with a man. You’d think times have changed.
